Class GameState

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.Model.GameControl.GameState
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Building_Phase_State, Flight_Phase_State, Initialization_Phase_State, Scoring_Phase_State
public class GameState extends Object implements Serializable

  • Field Details

    • game

      protected Game game
      Represents an instance of the game associated with the current game state. This variable is used to manage and interact with the primary game logic and elements throughout the lifecycle of the game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState(Game game)
      Creates a new instance of GameState associated with the specified game.
      Parameters:
      game - the game instance that this GameState will manage

  • Method Details

    • JoinGame

      public void JoinGame(String NickName, int NumOfPlayers) throws Exception
      Allows a player to join an ongoing game session.
      Parameters:
      NickName - The nickname of the player joining the game.
      NumOfPlayers - The number of players currently in the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the game cannot accommodate the new player or any other error occurs during the join process.

    • StateMain

      public void StateMain() throws Exception
      Represents the main state execution of the game. This method is placeholder and currently not supported.
      Throws:
      Exception - always thrown as the method is not implemented.

    • extractDeck

      public void extractDeck() throws RuntimeException
      Extracts the deck of cards or components associated with the game state. This method is intended to handle operations related to deck retrieval.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation is not supported or an error occurs during execution

    • activateTimer

      public void activateTimer(Player player) throws Exception
      Activates the timer for the specified player.
      Parameters:
      player - the player for whom the timer is to be activated
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an issue activating the timer

    • CheckandCorrectBuilding

      public int CheckandCorrectBuilding() throws Exception
      Verifies and corrects the building configuration for all players in the game. Iterates through each player's ship matrix and checks the positioning of each tile. If corrections are required, it modifies the ship configuration accordingly. The method continues corrections until the ship configuration becomes stable.
      Returns:
      1 if the building configuration is correct for all players, -1 if an invalid configuration is found during the verification process.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the validation or correction process.

    • setNumTile

      public void setNumTile(int playerid, int posTile) throws Exception
      Sets the number of tiles for a specific player's shipboard.
      Parameters:
      playerid - the unique identifier of the player whose shipboard tile count is to be set
      posTile - the number of tiles to set on the player's shipboard
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while setting the tile count

    • CommandFillTile

      public void CommandFillTile(int playerid, boolean wantalien, AlienColor color, int row, int column) throws Exception
      Fills a specified tile on the game board for the given player.
      Parameters:
      playerid - The ID of the player performing the action.
      wantalien - Indicates if the player wants to use an alien.
      color - The color of the alien to be used if applicable.
      row - The row index of the tile to be filled.
      column - The column index of the tile to be filled.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error occurs during the tile-filling operation.

    • completeBuildingPhase

      public void completeBuildingPhase() throws Exception
      Completes the current building phase in the game process. This method typically signals the conclusion of the building phase for a player or all players, depending on the game's context and state.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the completion of the building phase.

    • Surrend

      public void Surrend(int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to surrender and leave the game.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The unique identifier of the player who wishes to surrender.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the surrender process.

    • AutomaticFillTile

      public void AutomaticFillTile() throws Exception
      Automatically fills tiles for a player based on game logic. This method is intended to handle automatic filling of tiles during the game, typically used in scenarios where a player may not manually choose tiles or when automated game progression is required.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the automatic tile filling process encounters an error or cannot be completed due to unforeseen circumstances.

    • getNextState

      public GameState getNextState() throws Exception
      Retrieves the next state of the game. This method is expected to handle the transition between game states.
      Returns:
      the next GameState object representing the upcoming state in the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the transition to the next state cannot be performed.

    • visualizeFinalScores

      public HashMap<String,Float> visualizeFinalScores() throws RuntimeException
      Visualizes the final scores of the game for all players. This method generates a summary of final scores by providing the player names and their respective scores in a key-value format.
      Returns:
      a HashMap where the keys represent player names (String), and the values represent their final scores (Float).
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the method is not supported or cannot complete the operation.

    • pickTileAlreadyFlipped

      public void pickTileAlreadyFlipped(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Handles the action of picking a tile that has already been revealed.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the tile to be picked, representing its position in a collection or array.
      playerID - The unique identifier of the player attempting to pick the tile.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be completed or is not supported.

    • pickTileUnknown

      public void pickTileUnknown(int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to pick a tile of unknown properties. This may involve specific game logic to determine which tile is picked and its effects.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The unique identifier of the player performing the action.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be completed due to game rules or constraints.

    • pickTile

      public void pickTile(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to pick a specific tile during the game.
      Parameters:
      index - The index of the tile to be picked.
      playerID - The ID of the player picking the tile.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action is not supported or encounters an error.

    • demoGame

      public void demoGame() throws Exception
      Demonstrates a playable game session. This method is typically used to showcase the gameplay mechanics or simulate a session in the context of the current game state.
      Throws:
      Exception - If any error or exception occurs during the game demonstration.

    • pickLittleDeck

      public void pickLittleDeck(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to pick a smaller deck from a set of decks within the game. This method is intended to facilitate gameplay interaction related to deck management.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the small deck to be picked
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the action
      Throws:
      Exception - if the operation cannot be completed or is unsupported

    • depositLittleDeck

      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player performing the deck deposit.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the operation.

    • depositTile

      public void depositTile(int playerID) throws Exception
      Handles the action for depositing a tile associated with a specific player in the game state. The logic of this method is dependent on the current implementation of the game rules.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player who is depositing the tile
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the tile deposit process

    • endbuilding

      public void endbuilding(int PlayerID, int positionwheretogo) throws Exception
      Ends the building phase for a specific player and transitions to another position or state.
      Parameters:
      PlayerID - the ID of the player ending their building phase
      positionwheretogo - the position or state to transition to after ending the building phase
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the transition

    • endBuildingPhaseForAll

      public void endBuildingPhaseForAll() throws Exception
      Ends the building phase for all players in the game. This method is used to conclude the current building stage and transition to the subsequent phase for all players simultaneously.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while finalizing the building phase.

    • insertTile

      public void insertTile(int row, int col, int playerID, int rotation) throws Exception
      Inserts a tile into the game board at the specified position and updates the game state accordingly.
      Parameters:
      row - The row index where the tile will be inserted.
      col - The column index where the tile will be inserted.
      playerID - The ID of the player performing the action.
      rotation - The rotation of the tile to be inserted.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the insertion fails due to invalid input, invalid game state, or other errors.

    • EffectActivation

      public void EffectActivation() throws Exception
      Activates effects within the game state. This method is intended to handle the logic for triggering specific gameplay effects, which may include interacting with game objects, modifying state, or resolving actions. Throws: Exception - if an error occurs during the effect activation process.
      Throws:
      Exception

    • getCardinuse

      public Card getCardinuse() throws RuntimeException
      Retrieves the card currently in use in the game state.
      Returns:
      the card that is currently in use
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the operation is not supported

    • chooseOneSubShip

      public void chooseOneSubShip(int index, int playerID) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose a sub-ship based on the provided index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the sub-ship to select
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player making the selection
      Throws:
      Exception - if the selection process encounters an error

    • acceptToLandOnAPlanet

      public void acceptToLandOnAPlanet(Player p, boolean yOn, int NumPlanet) throws Exception
      Allows a player to accept or decline landing on a specific planet during the game.
      Parameters:
      p - The player who is deciding whether to land on the planet.
      yOn - A boolean indicating the player's choice; true if the player agrees to land, false otherwise.
      NumPlanet - The number of the planet the player wants to land on.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the action cannot be completed due to game state or other constraints.

    • chooseAbandonedStation

      public void chooseAbandonedStation(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods) throws Exception
      Handles the process where a player chooses an abandoned station during the game.
      Parameters:
      player - The player making the choice.
      flightBoard - The flight board associated with the game state.
      yOn - A boolean value indicating specific game state or condition.
      storageTiles - A 2D list of integers representing storage tiles.
      newGoods - A 2D list of goods to be placed in the abandoned station.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the operation.

    • chooseCannonBatteryPos

      public void chooseCannonBatteryPos(FlightBoard fb, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> cannonPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos) throws Exception
      Allows the player to choose positions for cannon batteries on the FlightBoard.
      Parameters:
      fb - The current FlightBoard instance where the cannon batteries will be placed.
      player - The Player making the selection of positions.
      cannonPos - A list of positions for the cannons specified as a nested ArrayList structure.
      batteriesPos - A list of positions for the batteries specified as a nested ArrayList structure.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the operation or invalid positions are selected.

    • chooseHowToFaceMeteors

      public void chooseHowToFaceMeteors(Player player, ArrayList<Integer> howToDefenceFromShots, FlightBoard flightBoard) throws Exception
      Determines how the player will face incoming meteors and manage their defense accordingly.
      Parameters:
      player - The player who is deciding how to defend against the meteors.
      howToDefenceFromShots - A list of integers representing the player's decisions or strategies for defending against meteor shots.
      flightBoard - The flight board representing the game state during the meteor encounter.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the decision-making process.

    • choosePassengersToLose

      public void choosePassengersToLose(Player p, boolean yOn, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> pass, FlightBoard flightBoard) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose which passengers to lose, based on the provided parameters.
      Parameters:
      p - The player who is making the decision about losing passengers.
      yOn - A boolean flag indicating whether a specific condition is activated during this decision-making process.
      pass - A 2D list containing details about the passengers, structured as a list of lists of integers.
      flightBoard - The current state of the flight board associated with the game.
      Throws:
      Exception - If the process of determining which passengers to lose cannot be completed or encounters an error.

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(boolean yOn, Player player) throws Exception
      Allows a player to decide whether to claim a reward or not during the game.
      Parameters:
      yOn - a boolean indicating the player's decision to claim the reward (true to claim, false otherwise)
      player - the player making the decision to claim the reward
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the execution of the method

    • chooseToClaimReward

      public void chooseToClaimReward(FlightBoard fb, boolean yOn, Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> storageTiles, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> newGoods) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose whether to claim a reward in the context of the game, involving the provided flight board, storage tiles, and goods.
      Parameters:
      fb - the flight board object representing the game state that may be relevant to the reward.
      yOn - a boolean indicating additional context or conditions for claiming the reward.
      player - the player object for whom the reward decision is being made.
      storageTiles - a two-dimensional ArrayList of integers representing the tiles in the player's storage.
      newGoods - a two-dimensional ArrayList of Goods representing the new goods that might be involved in the reward.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the reward claiming decision process.

    • chooseToPlaceBatteries

      public void chooseToPlaceBatteries(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posBatAndNumBattXPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to choose where to place the batteries within their configuration.
      Parameters:
      p - the player making the choice for battery placement
      posBatAndNumBattXPos - a two-dimensional list representing the possible positions for batteries and the corresponding number of batteries at each position
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs during the execution of the method

    • chooseToStartFirePower

      public void chooseToStartFirePower(Player p, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> DoubFireTriplets, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> BatteriesToAct) throws Exception
      Determines and initiates the sequence for activating double firepower and specified cannon batteries for a player during the game.
      Parameters:
      p - The player who is choosing to start firepower.
      DoubFireTriplets - A list of triplets, where each triplet denotes a double cannon activation.
      BatteriesToAct - A list of cannon battery positions to act upon during the firepower phase.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the process.

    • chooseToStartMotor

      public void chooseToStartMotor(Player player, FlightBoard flightBoard, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> enginesPos, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> batteriesPos) throws Exception
      Allows a player to attempt starting the motor of their ship using specified engines and batteries.
      Parameters:
      player - The player attempting to start the motor.
      flightBoard - The current state of the flight board.
      enginesPos - A list of engine positions that the player wants to activate.
      batteriesPos - A list of battery positions to be used for powering the engines.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during the process of starting the motor.

    • chooseWhereToPutGoods

      public void chooseWhereToPutGoods(Player player, ArrayList<ArrayList<Integer>> posGoods, ArrayList<ArrayList<Goods>> goodsSets) throws Exception
      Allows the player to determine where to place goods during the game.
      Parameters:
      player - the player making the decision about goods placement
      posGoods - a nested list of integers representing possible positions to place the goods
      goodsSets - a nested list of goods objects representing the sets of goods available for placement
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the decision-making process

    • startSurrenderTimer

      public void startSurrenderTimer() throws Exception
      Starts a timer that monitors the surrender process for players or game actions. This method initiates the countdown until the surrender is handled or processed.
      Throws:
      Exception - if the timer initialization or surrender processing fails.

    • onTimerComplete

      public void onTimerComplete(boolean isLastActivation) throws Exception
      Callback method invoked when a timer completes its countdown.
      Parameters:
      isLastActivation - indicates whether this is the final activation of the timer.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during timer completion handling.

    • insertWaitTile

      public void insertWaitTile(int playerID, int index, int row, int col, int rotation) throws Exception
      Inserts a wait tile for a specific player at a designated position with a specified rotation.
      Parameters:
      playerID - The unique identifier for the player.
      index - The index of the wait tile being inserted.
      row - The row position where the tile is to be placed.
      col - The column position where the tile is to be placed.
      rotation - The rotation value of the tile, typically in degrees.
      Throws:
      Exception - If there is an issue with inserting the tile.

    • addWaitTile

      public void addWaitTile(int playerID) throws Exception
      Adds a wait tile for the player identified by the given player ID.
      Parameters:
      playerID - the unique identifier of the player for whom the wait tile is being added
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while adding the wait tile
